decisions.summary: Proposal to bid $2.8 for sagewood with a rate of 8.5% or less.

emails.subject: Re: MISSION SOUTH
emails.body:
Jeff,

 I want to bid $2.8 for sagewood with a rate 8.5% or less and dependent on  
30 year term

decisions.summary: Request to modify the code that disallows choice markets in the trading system.

emails.body:
Dave:
Can you modify the code that disallows at choice market.  Sometimes the 
system will allow me to make a choice market by lowering my offer, sometimes 
it won't.  The system will never allow me to raise a bid to make a choice 
market.   I use this feature when 

The sytem should continue to disallow inverted markets, a market where the 
bid is greater than the offer.

decisions.summary: Need for major counterparties to have unlimited credit on EOL to prevent failed trades.

emails.body:
Dave:
A couple of issues:

1.  We continue to have a number of transactions that fail because of credit 
exposure.  These are companies that have excellent credit, such as Duke, 
Dynegy, Equitable, Mieco, etc, but have a fixed credit line on EOL that they 
blow through periodically.  They get a failed trade and it often takes 5-10 
minutes to rectify the problem, at which time we've lost the trade.   We need 
the major counterparties to have unlimited credit on EOL, just as they have 
in normal trading.

2.  As a corrallary, I am under the impression that when a trade fails 
because of credit, the counterparty does not get an explanatory error message 
describing what happened and what to do.  When a credit failure happens, the 
counterparty will often keep clicking on the same product, getting the same 
error message

decisions.summary: Draft memo regarding Sally Beck's role in operations for wholesale businesses to be sent out.

emails.subject: Draft Memo - Global Operations
emails.body:
Below is a draft of a memo that could be sent from you and Mark Frevert 
regarding further definition around my role in operations for the wholesale 
businesses.  

DRAFT

To mirror the commercial focus on our wholesale businesses, the trading 
operations support for these businesses will be will be led by Sally In light 
of recent organizational realignment

emails.body:
To:   ENW Administrative Assistants, ENW Department Heads
  From:  Sally Beck, Managing Director of ENW-Energy Operations

   To be determined once 1st memo is distributed, we sent out a communicati=
on=20
informing all ENW employees of the transfer from your old Enron company to=
=20
Enron Net Works.

   Today=01,s communication does include:
? New ENW Company Code
? New ENW Cost Centers listed by Department Head
? New ENW Organization Units
? Listing of HR Representatives and Financial Contact

=20

Implications for Business Unit Administrative Assistants

? If you are coding anything (including timekeeping, invoicing and expense=
=20
reports) to a cost center, NOT a WBS Element, code to the new company code=
=20
and cost center.
? If you are coding to a WBS Element, NOT a cost center, continue coding to=
=20
the existing company code and WBS Element number, regardless of the change =
in=20
cost centers.  ***WBS Element numbers may be revised at some point in the=
=20
future.  If they do change, the new numbers will be communicated at that=20
time.***
? If an employee or non-employee entered their time for the period starting=
=20
March 16th to the March 23st, that employee or non-employee must go back in=
to=20
SAP and re-enter their time.  Labor Distribution will be adversely affected=
=20
if the employee or non-employee does not go back in and re-submit their tim=
e=20
for this period.

Payroll Implications
? Effective with the April 1st re-org, expense and payroll charges will be=
=20
directed to new cost centers.

decisions.summary: Nominations for the CLE Planning Committee for the 2001 law conference to be identified before year end.

emails.subject: 2001 Law Conference
emails.body:
Jim, 

As we discussed, I would like to have nominations for the CLE Planning 
Committee for the 2001 law conference identified before year end so that the 
committee will be able to meet in early January.  Below is draft language for 
inclusion in an email from you to the general counsels of the various 
groups.  


The chair for the CLE Planning Committee for the 2001 Law Conference is 
Michelle Cash.  Each business unit law department should have at least one 
representative on the CLE committee.   The first CLE Planning Committee 
meeting will take place in early January; therefore, please give Michelle the 
name of your group's committee member by December 20.

  
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------

Michelle Cash
Enron North America Corp.
1400 Smith Street, EB 3823
Houston, Texas  77002
(713) 853-6401
michelle.cash@enron.com

This message may contain confidential information that is protected by the 
attorney-client and/or work product privileges.

decisions.summary: Postpone the ENA 2000 Offsite to early next year due to market volatility.

emails.subject: ENA 2000 Offsite
emails.body:
Given tremendous energy market volatility and as we stretch resources to make 
our commercial goals for 2000, it was decided that it would be appropriate to 
postpone the ENA 2000 Offsite to early next year.  I trust this meets with 
your approval and thanks for all the hard work.

Regards
Dave and John

decisions.summary: Propose to make an offer to Josh Chapa at a salary of $57,000 pending an interview.

emails.subject: Josh Chapa
emails.body:
Toni:  pending the Cynthia Lara interview tomorrow, I think I would like to 
make an offer to Josh.  I have interviewed him before, and he comes highly 
recommended.  He told me he is currently making $61,000 @ Dynegy, but I would 
like to offer a little less, somewhere in the $57,000 range.  Letr me know if 
you are ok with this, or what concerns you may have.  Let me know.  Thanks.

decisions.summary: Reorganized the Wholesale Services Legal Department to align with business units and improve efficiency.

emails.subject: Enron Wholesale Services Legal Department
emails.body:
As a follow-up to the recent Enron Corp. memorandum forming Enron Wholesale 
Services (EWS), effective today, we have reorganized the Wholesale Services 
Legal Department.

 The goals in reorganizing the department are as follows:  (i) align the 
legal department as closely as possible with the business units, (ii) speed 
the flow of legal technology across the business units, and (iii) achieve 
greater efficiency and consistency across the organization.

 To this end, a legal policy group will be formed for EWS Legal, which will 
include Lance Schuler, Enron Americas; Mark Evans, Enron Europe; Mark Taylor, 
Enron Net Works; Alan Aronowitz, Enron Global Markets; Julia Murray, Enron 
Industrial Markets; and Bruce Lundstrom, Enron Global Assets.

 The organization chart for the EWS Legal Department is attached.  More 
comprehensive organization charts will follow for each group.

Mark Frevert and Mark Haedicke

decisions.summary: Implemented a legal review process for third-party electronic trading platforms to ensure compliance.

emails.subject: LEGAL REVIEW OF THIRD PARTY ELECTRONIC TRADING PLATFORMS
emails.body:
In order to ensure adequate, consistent legal review of on-line terms and=
=20
conditions governing use of third party electronic trading platforms, you=
=20
must have all registration documentation (including, for example, password=
=20
applications and access agreements) approved by the On-Line Trading Legal=
=20
Contact before such documentation is submitted or executed.  Any document=
=20
that requires acceptance by =01&clicking=018 should be treated like any oth=
er legal=20
document.  You are not authorized to accept any such click agreement withou=
t=20
written approval of the On-Line Trading Legal Contact.  In addition, the=20
On-Line Trading Legal Contact must review and approve all product=20
descriptions and other on-line terms and conditions applicable to a product=
=20
before a password may be used to trade that product on a third party=20
electronic trading platform.  Accordingly, before any master user or subuse=
r=20
uses a password to trade a product, he or she must confirm that the On-Line=
=20
Trading Legal Contact has approved all applicable product descriptions and=
=20
terms and conditions applicable to such product.=20

The current On-Line Trading Legal Contact is Mark Greenberg (extension 5889=
7)=20
(or in his absence, Mark Taylor (extension 37459)). =20

decisions.summary: Proposed the start-up of electronic trading for drafting and negotiation of energy contracts.

emails.subject: Creating Worldwide Electronic Trading Form
emails.body:
I believe the start-up of click trading is an opportune time to go electronic 
on all aspects of the drafting and negotiation of master energy contracts and 
confirmations.  At least one law firm has a  project underway where the goal 
is to type in the country, the commodity type (including quantity and time) 
and to have a draft trading contract be the immediate result.  The concept is 
one of "modular" construction of trading contracts with maximum 
standardization and minimum differences country to country and commodity to 
commodity.  I want everyone to be thinking about how this can be 
accomplished.  I will schedule a meeting on this shortly.
